page.title: 12GLENURQUHART SHINTY CLUB
page.content: {Shinty}is a popular sport in the Glen. It is played at all age levels from under 12's (primary level) through under 14's, under 17's to adult. There are{12}players in each team and the object of the game is to strike a small leather ball with the shinty stick or{caman}into your opponents goal which is narrower and higher than football goals. Fouls are given for deliberately hitting other players, kicking the ball, throwing your stick and for offside. The Glen have a first & second which play in the{North of Scotland}first & third divisions.{1985}is the{centenary {year}of the club and the first organised shinty match which was between the{Glen & Strathglass. Shinty's major prize is the{Camanachd {Cup}which is played for by all the teams in{Scotland.
